Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Menin):
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Application Nos. C 260042 PCK and C 260040 PPK (395 Flatbush Avenue Ext. Redevelopment) shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 395 Flatbush Avenue Ext. Redevelopment, Brooklyn (C 260042 PCK and C 260040 PPK).

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Menin):
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Application Nos. C 260026 ZSK, C 260027 PPK, C 260029 PQK, and C 260012 PPK (Seaside Park & Community Arts Center Special Permit) shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, Seaside Park & Community Arts Center Special Permit, Brooklyn (C 260026 ZSK, C 260027 PPK, C 260029 PQK and C 260012 PPK).

Items.Title:
By Council Member Hanif:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Application No. C 250304 PQK (Prospect Farm Acquisition) shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, Prospect Farm Acquisition, Brooklyn (C 250304 PQK).

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Menin):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 19-160.2 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving a sidewalk café located at 1692 Second Avenue, New York, NY 10028, Borough of Manhattan, Council District 5, Community District 8, related to Application No. D 2550015858 SWM (Ethyl's Alcohol & Food) shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Ethyl's Alcohol & Food, Manhattan (D 2550015858 SWM).

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.
Items.AgendaNote: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS - Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Menin) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Menin), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, January 29, 2026.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
